title: Why are you so bloody lazy?
content:
[hr]Levelass recent experience is making me agree with Levellord, online communities are procrastinators at best.
[hr]
[hr]Levelass Yay! Someone is actually *doing* something Huzzah!
[hr]
[hr]Levelass People here are too lazy to flame.
[hr]
It seems someone's trying to get a message across.

So, why is it that we're all so 'lazy'? What goes through your mind when you try to work on a project that you feel is of some significance, to the Keen community or otherwise? What is it that inhibits your persistence and keeps you from seeing something through?

Of course there's the obvious "This sucks and it's too complicated" aspect, or "I don't have time for it", but I'm curious as to what lies behind these reasons.

I'll post my own response later. I'm too lazy right now.

title: f
content:
I will post my opinion on this later.
For a change this has nothing to do with being lazy.

title: Re: Why are you so bloody lazy?
content:
Often the cause of me not seeing a project through to completion is because I spend heaps of time working on it in the first few days of starting the project, and then suddenly become so sick of it that I don't even want to think about it for the next week...

By the time I 'recover', I've usually entirely forgotten about the project.


Other times, I'd have started a project only to have an exam or something come up and distract me for a few days. After the distraction is taken care of, I'd have once again completely forgotten about the project.


I guess it's not so much that I don't feel like completing projects, it's that I keep forgetting that I'd ever thought of them in the first place that is my problem.

title: Re: Why are you so bloody lazy?
content:
In my case the reason is usually lack of skills and motivation more than laziness. However, if I like to do something I'll do it faster than if I don't like it.

Many have so much other things to do, or just don't want to waste countless hours on something nobody cares about, not even them theirselves.

Anyways, I'm tired.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Why are you so bloody lazy?
content:
The reason I never get anything done is the internet. Or, perhaps more accurately, because just sitting around reading websites requires less effort.

When I'm, say, level editing, I tend to have a web browser open at the same time as the level editor. This has proven to be detrimental to my productivity.

If I could use less internet, I'd get more stuff done.------------------
www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk My website is going to go back online
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: time!!
content:
I've explained my lack of time plenty... let's just say I'm out the door for college at about 6:30am and not home until after 8pm Monday thru Wednesday, and 6pm Thursday and Friday. By the time I get home, I've got a girlfriend, homework, and housework to keep up with... Saturdays, if I'm not going out and doing college-related music stuff (performances, conferences) I'm hanging out with friends, finding time to decompress. I don't feel like doing ANYTHING during those times--I will literally just sit on my keyster and just watch whatever's going on. Movies are great for this.

I've started working on things on the side, though, while I have free time at work--I spent the past 2 weeks looking into the Bounder thing over at K:M and finally realized why it wasn't working--it's something totally beyond me. That means that, next time I have free time, I'll be working on graphics instead of patching stuff... but I've got midterms this week and next.

Long story short: I'm not in high school anymore, and I've got lots of commitments that are more career-valuable than Keen.

title: Re: Meh
content: The main reason I do so little is because I'm bad at time management and don't have a great deal of motivation - whilst I have a large number of ideas, I have trouble sticking to them unless I can have a working result within a day or two. The initial result might not necessarily have all the features I want it to have, but it should be functional to some extent. For example, I had many more features planned for my [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumother.showMessage?topicID=2474.topic]CKFS[/url] hosting site, but I eventually settled for starting off with a simple off-the-hook file upload app rather than simply having nothing at all.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Meh
content:
Cause I don't spend ever second working on Keen stuff. I draw, animate, write, etc, and most of it isn't Keen-related. So, to the PCKF's point of view, it looks like I'm doing very little, when actually, I'm doing a lot.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Meh
content:
I too am busy, busy, busy. I've got instruments to practice (and at least one of them demands to be played daily), classes to attend, books to read, games to play, equipment to build, bands to play in, and Internet to keep an eye on, papers to write, recording to do, work, and so on. And that's just the regular stuff. Who knows what paperwork or car maintenance or civic duty will rear its head? By the time I get a free moment there's so much waiting to fall in that I don't have hours to spend drawing pixels (even when I'd like to).________________

title: haha
content:
Levelass, you're thinking of Brass. I said Bass, as in low. Here's a good link showing [url=http://hem.passagen.se/eriahl/clarinet.htm]the whole Clarinet family[/url]. The B-flat Clarinet is the "normal" one, with the B-flat Bass Clarinet being the second most common. If you want a metallic clarinet, check out the awesome B-flat ContraBass Clarinet--it's huge and fun to play. I didn't even know they HAD SubContraBass, but I'd love to see one. Too bad that site didn't have pictures.

Anyway, in our Clarinet Choir at SDSU, we have an Eb Clarinet, several Bb Clarinets, two Eb Altos, two Bb Basses, two Eb ContraAltos, and a Bb ContraBass. Lots of fun arrangements and such. But no brass, per se.

Derail complete!~

title: Re: haha

title: Re: Why are you so bloody lazy?
content:
My turn.

When I'm not in the right frame of mind, concentration and effort cause me pain. When I know exactly what I want to see in front of me, and know exactly what I need to do next to make it happen, action is easy.

But when I reach a limit in my skills and don't know where to find the answers and get lost in a tangle of google searches, or lose sight of the bigger picture, things get messy. I can keep chipping away at the task, but I'll feel increasingly more "grey", a mixture of anger, despair and boredom, which is very difficult to escape if I let it take hold. This feeling can then attach itself to the project and taint my future motivation to work on it.
